Spanish.Text: Soldado con espada pesada:Soldados con espada pesada
Soldado con espada ligera:Soldados con espada ligera

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Bulgars were highly skilled in the equestrian arts. Their army mainly consisted of horseman because of their high skill. Every Bulgar horseman had high discipline and had several horses. However, only a single horse could be used for wartime matters, and it was forbidden to do anything else with it. It is believed that the Bulgars were the first who brought the stirrups to Europe. This gave them advantages above the other European armies of this time. The Bulgars could use bows still mounted on horses. Swords and spears were also used in war. The stirrups also increased the stability and speed of the rider.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le Bulgars Ã©taient fortement habile dans les arts Ã©questres. Leur armÃ©e s'est principalement composÃ©e du cavalier en raison de leur compÃ©tence Ã©levÃ©e. Chaque cavalier de Bulgar a eu la discipline Ã©levÃ©e et a eu plusieurs chevaux. Cependant, seulement un cheval simple pourrait Ãªtre employÃ© pour des sujets de temps de guerre, et on l'a interdit de faire toute autre chose avec lui. On le croit que le Bulgars Ã©taient le premier qui a apportÃ© les Ã©triers Ã l'Europe. Ceci leur a donnÃ© des avantages au-dessus des autres armÃ©es europÃ©ennes de ce temps. Le Bulgars a pu employer des arcs toujours montÃ©s sur des chevaux. Des Ã©pÃ©es et les lances ont Ã©tÃ© Ã©galement utilisÃ©es dans la guerre. Les Ã©triers ont Ã©galement augmentÃ© la stabilitÃ© et la vitesse du cavalier.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das Bulgars waren in die ReiterkÃ¼nste in hohem Grade erfahren. Ihre Armee bestand hauptsÃ¤chlich aus Reiter wegen ihrer hohen FÃ¤higkeit. Jeder Bulgar Reiter hatte hohe Disziplin und hatte einige Pferde. Jedoch nur ein einzelnes Pferd kÃ¶nnte fÃ¼r Kriegangelegenheiten benutzt werden, und es war verboten, um noch etwas mit ihm zu tun. Es wird geglaubt, daÃŸ das Bulgars das erste waren, wer die SteigbÃ¼gel zu Europa holte. Dieses gab ihnen Vorteile Ã¼ber den anderen europÃ¤ischen Armeen dieser Zeit. Das Bulgars konnte die BÃ¶gen benutzen, die noch an den Pferden angebracht wurden. Klingen und Stangen wurden auch im Krieg benutzt. Die SteigbÃ¼gel erhÃ¶hten auch die StabilitÃ¤t und die Geschwindigkeit des Mitfahrers.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il Bulgars era altamente esperto nelle arti equestrian. Il loro esercito pricipalmente ha consistito del horseman a causa dell'loro elevata specializzazione. Ogni horseman di Bulgar ha avuto alta disciplina ed ha avuto parecchi cavalli. Tuttavia, soltanto un singolo cavallo potrebbe essere usato per gli argomenti di wartime ed Ã¨ stato proibito a per fargli niente altro con. Si crede che il Bulgars sia stato il primo chi ha portato le staffe ad Europa. CiÃ² ha dato loro i vantaggi sopra gli altri eserciti europei di questo tempo. Il Bulgars ha potuto usare gli archi ancora montati sui cavalli. Le spade ed i germogli inoltre sono stati utilizzati nella guerra. Le staffe inoltre hanno aumentato la stabilitÃ e la velocitÃ del rider.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Bulgars era altamente experto en los artes ecuestres. Su ejÃ©rcito consistiÃ³ en principalmente el jinete debido a su alta habilidad. Cada jinete de Bulgar tenÃ­a alta disciplina y tenÃ­a varios caballos. Sin embargo, solamente un solo caballo podrÃ­a ser utilizado para las materias del tiempo de guerra, y fue prohibido para hacer todo lo demÃ¡s con Ã©l. Se cree que el Bulgars era el primer quiÃ©n trajo los estribos a Europa. Esto les dio ventajas sobre los otros ejÃ©rcitos europeos de este tiempo. El Bulgars podÃ­a utilizar los arcos todavÃ­a montados en caballos. Las espadas y las lanzas tambiÃ©n fueron utilizadas en guerra. Los estribos tambiÃ©n aumentaron la estabilidad y la velocidad del jinete.
TEXT.Russian: [TAB]The Bulgars were highly skilled in the equestrian arts. Their army mainly consisted of horseman because of their high skill. Every Bulgar horseman had high discipline and had several horses. However, only a single horse could be used for wartime matters, and it was forbidden to do anything else with it. It is believed that the Bulgars were the first who brought the stirrups to Europe. This gave them advantages above the other European armies of this time. The Bulgars could use bows still mounted on horses. Swords and spears were also used in war. The stirrups also increased the stability and speed of the rider.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Zaporozhian Cossacks were Cossacks who lived in Zaporizhya, a region in Central Ukraine. The Zaporozhian Host grew rapidly in the 15th century by serfs escaping the Polish Lithuanian Commonwealth. The base and fortress of the Cossacks was the Zaporozhian Sich, which was originally built in the area known as Zaporizhia. During the course of the 16th, 17th and well into the 18th century, the Zaporozhian Cossacks became a strong political and military forced that challenged the authority of the Poland-Lithuania, the Ottoman Empire and its vassal, the Crimean Khanate, and the Tsardom of Russia. The Host underwent a sequence of conflicts and alliances involving the three powers before being destroyed in the late 18th century by the Russian Empire.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les Cosaques de Zaporozhian Ã©taient les Cosaques qui ont habitÃ© dans Zaporizhya, une rÃ©gion en Ukraine centrale. Le centre serveur de Zaporozhian s'est dÃ©veloppÃ© rapidement au 15Ã¨me siÃ¨cle par des serfs Ã©chappant au Commonwealth lithuanien polonais. La base et la forteresse des Cosaques Ã©taient le Zaporozhian Sich, qui a Ã©tÃ© Ã l'origine construit dans le secteur connu sous le nom de Zaporizhia. Pendant le 16Ã¨me, le 17Ã¨me et bien dans le 18Ã¨me siÃ¨cle, les Cosaques de Zaporozhian est devenu un obligatoire politique et militaire fort qui a dÃ©fiÃ© l'autoritÃ© de la Pologne-Lithuanie, l'empire de tabouret et son vassal, le Khanate crimÃ©en, et le Tsardom de la Russie. Le centre serveur a subi un ordre des conflits et des alliances impliquant les trois puissances avant d'Ãªtre dÃ©truit vers la fin du 18Ã¨me siÃ¨cle par l'empire russe.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Zaporozhian Kosaken waren Kosaken, die in Zaporizhya wohnten, eine Region in zentraler Ukraine. Der Zaporozhian Wirt wuchs schnell im 15. Jahrhundert durch die Sklaven, die dem polnischen litauischen Commonwealth entgehen. Die Unterseite und die Festung der Kosaken waren das Zaporozhian Sich, das ursprÃ¼nglich im Bereich errichtet wurde, der als Zaporizhia bekannt ist. WÃ¤hrend des 16. wurde 17. und gut in das 18. Jahrhundert, die Zaporozhian Kosaken ein starkes politisches und militÃ¤risches Zwangs-, das die Berechtigung des Polen-Litauens, des Ottoman-Reiches und seines vassal herausforderten, das KrimKhanate und das Tsardom von RuÃŸland. Der Wirt machte eine Reihenfolge der Konflikte und der BÃ¼ndnisse durch, welche die drei Energien mit einbeziehen, bevor er Ende des 18. Jahrhunderts durch das russische Reich zerstÃ¶rt wurde.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I Cossacks di Zaporozhian erano Cossacks che hanno vissuto in Zaporizhya, una regione in Ucraina centrale. L'ospite di Zaporozhian si Ã¨ sviluppato velocemente nel quindicesimo secolo dai servi che fuoriescono il commonwealth lituano polacco. La base ed il fortress dei Cossacks erano lo Zaporozhian Sich, che originalmente Ã¨ stato costruito nella zona conosciuta come Zaporizhia. Durante il corso del sedicesimo, il diciassettesimo e facilmente per il diciottesimo secolo, i Cossacks di Zaporozhian si Ã¨ trasformato in in un forzato politico e militare forte che ha sfidato l'autoritÃ della Polonia-Lituania, l'impero del Ottoman ed il relativo vassal, nel Khanate della Crimea e nel Tsardom della Russia. L'ospite ha subito una sequenza dei conflitti e delle alleanze che coinvolgono le tre alimentazioni prima del essere distruttoe verso la fine del diciottesimo secolo dall'impero russo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los Cossacks de Zaporozhian eran los Cossacks que vivieron en Zaporizhya, una regiÃ³n en Ucrania central. El anfitriÃ³n de Zaporozhian creciÃ³ rÃ¡pidamente en el dÃ©cimo quinto siglo por los siervos que escapaban la Commonwealth lituana polaca. La base y la fortaleza de los Cossacks eran el Zaporozhian Sich, que fue construido originalmente en el Ã¡rea conocida como Zaporizhia. Durante el curso del dÃ©cimosexto, el 17mo y bien en el dÃ©cimo octavo siglo, los Cossacks de Zaporozhian se convirtiÃ³ en un forzado polÃ­tico y militar fuerte que desafiÃ³ la autoridad de la Polonia-Lituania, el imperio del otomano y su vassal, el Khanate crimeo, y el Tsardom de Rusia. El anfitriÃ³n experimentÃ³ una secuencia de los conflictos y de las alianzas que implicaban las tres energÃ­as antes de ser destruido en el Ãºltimo dÃ©cimo octavo siglo por el imperio ruso.
TEXT.Russian: [TAB]The Zaporozhian Cossacks were Cossacks who lived in Zaporizhya, a region in Central Ukraine. The Zaporozhian Host grew rapidly in the 15th century by serfs escaping the Polish Lithuanian Commonwealth. The base and fortress of the Cossacks was the Zaporozhian Sich, which was originally built in the area known as Zaporizhia. During the course of the 16th, 17th and well into the 18th century, the Zaporozhian Cossacks became a strong political and military forced that challenged the authority of the Poland-Lithuania, the Ottoman Empire and its vassal, the Crimean Khanate, and the Tsardom of Russia. The Host underwent a sequence of conflicts and alliances involving the three powers before being destroyed in the late 18th century by the Russian Empire.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The first hussar units in the Kingdom of Poland were formed by the Sejm, the Polish Parliament, in 1503 which hired three banners of Hungarian mercenaries. Soon, recruitment also began among Polish and Lithuanian citizens. The Hussars proved vital to Poland because they were more maneuverable than the previously used lancers. But the reign of King Stefan Batory, the hussars formed the bulk of the Polish and Lithuanian cavalry. Over many years, hussars in Hungary became heavier. When Stefan Batory was elected king of Poland, he reorganized the Polish-Lithuanian hussars of his Royal Guard making them a heavy formation, and equipping lancers as their main weapon. These Polish 'heavy' hussars were known in their homeland as "husaria" [PARAGRAPH: 1] With the Battle of Lubiszew in 1577, the "Golden Age" of the hussar began. Until the Battle of Vienna, Polish-Lithuanian hussars rarely lost in battle. Throughout many battles the Polish-Lithuanian hussars would prove to be an important factor against overwhelming odds. [PARAGRAPH: 1] The primary battle tactic of the Polish-Lithuanian hussars was the charge. They also tended to repeat the charge until the enemy formation broke. The hussars fought with a long lance, a szabla, one or two pistols, and a carbine or arquebus, known in Polish as a "bandolet". Polish hussars were also famous for the wings they wore on their backs. According to some theories, they were designed to foil attacks by Tatar lassos, another theory being that the vibrating of feathers made a strange sound that frightened enemy horses. However, experiments carried out by re-enactors and movie-makers since the 1970s and more recently by Polish historians in 2001 contradict such ideas. Possibly the wings were worn only during parades and not during combat, but this explanation is also disputed.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La premiÃ¨re hussarde unitÃ©s dans le Royaume de Pologne ont Ã©tÃ© formÃ©s par le Sejm, le Parlement polonais, en 1503, qui a engagÃ© trois banniÃ¨res de mercenaires hongrois. BientÃ´t, le recrutement a commencÃ© entre les citoyens polonais et lituaniens. Les Hussards avÃ©rÃ©e vitale pour la Pologne, parce qu'ils Ã©taient plus manoeuvrable que les lanciers prÃ©cÃ©demment utilisÃ©s. But le rÃ¨gne du roi Stefan Batory, les hussards formaient le gros de la cavalerie polonaise et lituanienne. Depuis de nombreuses annÃ©es, hussards en Hongrie est devenue plus lourde. Lorsque Stefan Batory est Ã©lu roi de Pologne, il a rÃ©organisÃ© le polonais-lituanien hussards de sa garde royale rendant une lourde formation et l'Ã©quipement des lanciers comme leur principale arme. Ces polonais "lourds" hussards Ã©taient connus dans leur pays comme "husaria" [PARAGRAPH: 1] Avec la bataille de Lubiszew en 1577, l'Ã¢ge d'or "de la hussarde a commencÃ©. Jusqu'Ã la bataille de Vienne, polonais-lituanien hussards rarement perdu dans la bataille. Tout au long de nombreuses batailles l'polonais-lituanien hussards se rÃ©vÃ©ler Ãªtre un important facteur Ã©crasante contre chances. [PARAGRAPH: 1] La principale bataille tactique de la polonais-lituanien hussards a la charge. Ils ont Ã©galement tendance Ã rÃ©pÃ©ter les frais jusqu'Ã la formation ennemie a Ã©clatÃ©. Les hussards combattu avec une longue Lance, un szabla, un ou deux pistolets, et un mousqueton ou arquebuse, connue en polonais comme un "bandolet". Hussards polonais Ã©taient reconnus pour les ailes, ils portaient sur leur dos. Selon certaines thÃ©ories, mais ils ont Ã©tÃ© conÃ§us pour dÃ©jouer les attaques menÃ©es par des lassos tatare, une autre thÃ©orie est que la vibration de plumes fait une Ã©trange que le son ennemi effrayÃ© les chevaux. Toutefois, les expÃ©riences menÃ©es par la rÃ©orientation enactors et film dÃ©cideurs depuis les annÃ©es 1970 et, plus rÃ©cemment, par les historiens polonais en 2001 contredisent de telles idÃ©es. Eventuellement les ailes ont Ã©tÃ© portÃ©es seulement pendant les parades et non pas pendant le combat, mais cette explication est Ã©galement contestÃ©.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die ersten Husaren in das KÃ¶nigreich Polen wurden durch den Sejm, das polnische Parlament, in der 1503 die drei gemietet Banner der ungarischen SÃ¶ldnern. Bald begann auch die Einstellung der polnischen und litauischen BÃ¼rger. Die Husaren als entscheidend fÃ¼r Polen, weil sie mehr wendiger als die bisher verwendeten SpeertrÃ¤ger. But der Regierungszeit von KÃ¶nig Stefan Batory, die Husaren bilden den grÃ¶ÃŸten Teil der polnischen und litauischen Kavallerie. Ãœber viele Jahre, Husaren in Ungarn wurde schwerer. Wenn Stefan Batory gewÃ¤hlt wurde KÃ¶nig von Polen, er hat die Polnisch Husaren seiner Royal Guard und machen sie zu einer schweren Ausbildung, AusrÃ¼stung und SpeertrÃ¤ger als ihre wichtigste Waffe. Diese polnischen "schwere" Husaren bekannt waren, in ihrer eigenen Heimat als "husaria" [PARAGRAPH: 1] Mit der Schlacht von Lubiszew im 1577, das "Goldene Zeitalter" der Husaren begann. Bis in die Schlacht von Wien, Polnisch Husaren selten verloren in der Schlacht. In vielen Schlachten der polnischen Husaren - Litauisch wÃ¼rde sich als ein wichtiger Faktor gegen die Ã¼berwÃ¤ltigende Quoten. [PARAGRAPH: 1] Der primÃ¤re Kampf Taktik der polnisch-litauischen Husaren war. DarÃ¼ber hinaus neigten die GebÃ¼hr zu wiederholen, bis der Feind Bildung pleite. Die Husaren kÃ¤mpften mit einer langen Lanze, ein szabla, ein oder zwei Pistolen, und einem Karabiner oder arquebus, die in der polnischen als "bandolet." Polnischen Husaren waren auch berÃ¼hmt fÃ¼r die FlÃ¼gel trugen sie auf dem RÃ¼cken. Nach einigen Theorien, sie wurden so gestaltet, dass Folie Angriffe von Tataren Lassos, eine andere Theorie ist, dass die Vibrationen von Federn, die ein seltsames GerÃ¤usch, Angst Feind Pferde. Allerdings, Experimente durchgefÃ¼hrt erneut enactors und Film EntscheidungstrÃ¤ger seit den 1970er Jahren und in jÃ¼ngster Zeit von den polnischen Historiker in der 2001 im Widerspruch zu solchen Ideen. MÃ¶glicherweise die FlÃ¼gel getragen wurden nur wÃ¤hrend der Paraden und nicht wÃ¤hrend des Kampfes, aber diese ErklÃ¤rung ist auch umstritten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La prima unitÃ ussaro nel Regno di Polonia si sono formati dal Sejm, il parlamento polacco, nel 1503, che noleggiati tre bandiere ungheresi di mercenari. Presto, ha iniziato il reclutamento anche tra i cittadini polacchi e lituani. Il Ussari rivelato fondamentale per la Polonia perchÃ© erano piÃ¹ manovrabile da quella usata in precedenza lance. Ma il regno di Stefan Batory, la ussari formata la maggior parte della cavalleria polacco e lituano. Nel corso di molti anni, ussari in Ungheria Ã¨ diventata piÃ¹ pesante. Stefan Batory, quando Ã¨ stato eletto re di Polonia, ha riorganizzato il Polacco-Lituana ussari del suo Royal Guard rendendoli un pesante formazione, e di dotare le lance come loro principale arma. Questi polacco 'pesanti' ussari erano conosciuti in patria come "husaria" [N: 1] Con la Battaglia di Lubiszew nel 1577, il "Golden Age" del ussaro iniziato. Fino alla battaglia di Vienna, polacco - lituano ussari raramente perso in battaglia. In molti battaglie polacco - lituano ussari sarebbe rivelato un fattore importante contro la stragrande quota. [PARAGRAPH: 1] La principale battaglia tattica del Polacco-Lituana ussari era l'accusa. Essi hanno anche la tendenza a ripetere la carica fino a quando il nemico formazione rotto. Il ussari combattuto con una lunga lancia, un szabla, uno o due pistole, e di una carabina o arquebus, in polacco noto come "bandolet". Ussari polacchi sono stati anche famosa per le ali che indossavano sulle loro spalle. Secondo alcune teorie, che sono stati progettati per sventare attacchi da Tataro lassos, un'altra teoria Ã¨ che la vibrazione di piume fatto uno strano suono che spaventati nemico cavalli. Tuttavia, gli esperimenti effettuati da ristabilire enactors movie e responsabili dal 1970 e, piÃ¹ recentemente, dal polacco storici nel 2001 in contrasto con tali idee. Eventualmente, le ali sono stati indossati solo durante parate, e non durante il combattimento, ma questa spiegazione Ã¨ anche contestato.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La primera hussar unidades en el Reino de Polonia se formaron por el Sejm, el Parlamento polaco, en 1503, que contratÃ³ a tres pancartas hÃºngaro de los mercenarios. En breve, tambiÃ©n se iniciÃ³ la contrataciÃ³n entre los ciudadanos polacos y lituanos. El Hussars resultÃ³ vital para Polonia, ya que fueron mÃ¡s maniobrable que los utilizados anteriormente lancers. But el reinado del rey Stefan Batory, la hussars forman el grueso de la caballerÃ­a polaco y lituano. Durante muchos aÃ±os, hussars en HungrÃ­a se convirtiÃ³ en mÃ¡s pesadas. Cuando Stefan Batory fue elegido rey de Polonia, se reorganizÃ³ el polaco - lituano hussars de su Guardia Real convierten en una pesada formaciÃ³n, y el equipamiento lancers como su principal arma. Estos polaco 'pesadas' hussars eran conocidos en su tierra natal como "husaria" [PARAGRAPH: 1] Con la Batalla de Lubiszew en 1577, la "Edad de Oro" de la hussar comenzÃ³. Hasta la Batalla de Viena, polaco, lituano hussars rara vez perdiÃ³ en la batalla. Muchas batallas en todo el polaco - lituano hussars resultarÃ­a ser un factor importante en contra de enormes dificultades. [PARAGRAPH: 1] La principal batalla de la tÃ¡ctica polaca y lituana hussars era el cargo. TambiÃ©n tienden a repetir el cargo hasta que el enemigo rompiÃ³ la formaciÃ³n. El hussars luchÃ³ con una larga lanza, un szabla, una o dos pistolas, y una carabina o arquebus, conocido en Polonia como una "bandolet". Polish hussars tambiÃ©n famoso por las alas que llevaban en sus espaldas. SegÃºn algunas teorÃ­as, que estaban diseÃ±adas para frustrar los ataques de tÃ¡rtaro lassos, otra teorÃ­a es que la vibraciÃ³n de plumas hizo un extraÃ±o sonido que asustados caballos enemigo. Sin embargo, los experimentos llevados a cabo por volver a enactors y de la pelÃ­cula de la formulaciÃ³n desde el decenio de 1970 y mÃ¡s recientemente por historiadores de Polonia en 2001 contradice esas ideas. Posiblemente las alas se usaron sÃ³lo durante los desfiles y no durante el combate, pero esta explicaciÃ³n es tambiÃ©n controvertida.
TEXT.Russian: [TAB]The first hussar units in the Kingdom of Poland were formed by the Sejm, the Polish Parliament, in 1503 which hired three banners of Hungarian mercenaries. Soon, recruitment also began among Polish and Lithuanian citizens. The Hussars proved vital to Poland because they were more maneuverable than the previously used lancers. But the reign of King Stefan Batory, the hussars formed the bulk of the Polish and Lithuanian cavalry. Over many years, hussars in Hungary became heavier. When Stefan Batory was elected king of Poland, he reorganized the Polish-Lithuanian hussars of his Royal Guard making them a heavy formation, and equipping lancers as their main weapon. These Polish 'heavy' hussars were known in their homeland as "husaria" [PARAGRAPH: 1] With the Battle of Lubiszew in 1577, the "Golden Age" of the hussar began. Until the Battle of Vienna, Polish-Lithuanian hussars rarely lost in battle. Throughout many battles the Polish-Lithuanian hussars would prove to be an important factor against overwhelming odds. [PARAGRAPH: 1] The primary battle tactic of the Polish-Lithuanian hussars was the charge. They also tended to repeat the charge until the enemy formation broke. The hussars fought with a long lance, a szabla, one or two pistols, and a carbine or arquebus, known in Polish as a "bandolet". Polish hussars were also famous for the wings they wore on their backs. According to some theories, they were designed to foil attacks by Tatar lassos, another theory being that the vibrating of feathers made a strange sound that frightened enemy horses. However, experiments carried out by re-enactors and movie-makers since the 1970s and more recently by Polish historians in 2001 contradict such ideas. Possibly the wings were worn only during parades and not during combat, but this explanation is also disputed.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Karolins were soldiers of the Swedish kings Charles XI and Charles XII. They were part of the yearly Swedish allotment system. The Karolins' tactics were to attack fiercely and remain unafraid. The soldiers also sustained stern discipline, which over the extensive course of a twenty-year-long war would prove vital. The Swedish army tactics of the time did not teach retreat, so the soldiers were known to never withdraw from battle.

TEXT.German: [TAB]Das Caroleans waren Soldaten der schwedischen KÃ¶nige Charles XI und Charles XII. Sie waren ein Teil des jÃ¤hrlichen schwedischen Zuteilung Systems. Die Taktiken des Caroleans waren, wÃ¼tend anzugreifen und furchtlos zu bleiben. Die Soldaten unterstÃ¼tzten auch stern Disziplin, die Ã¼ber dem umfangreichen Kurs eines Zwanzig-Jahr-langen Krieges lebenswichtiges prÃ¼fen wÃ¼rde. TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il Caroleans era soldati dei re svedesi Charles XI e Charles XII. Facevano parte del sistema svedese annuale di assegnazione. Le tattiche del Caroleans erano di attacare ferocemente e rimanere unafraid. I soldati inoltre hanno sostenuto la disciplina severa, che sopra il vasto corso di una guerra venti-anno-lunga dimostrerebbe vitale. Le tattiche svedesi dell'esercito del tempo non hanno insegnato la ritirata, in modo da i soldati sono stati conosciuti per non ritirarsi mai dalla battaglia.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El Caroleans era soldados de los reyes suecos Charles XI y Charles XII. Eran parte del sistema sueco anual de la asignaciÃ³n. Las tÃ¡ctica del Caroleans eran atacar ferozmente y seguir siendo sin miedo. Los soldados tambiÃ©n sostuvieron la disciplina severa, que sobre el curso extenso de una guerra veinte-aÃ±o-larga probarÃ­a vital. Las tÃ¡ctica suecas del ejÃ©rcito del tiempo no enseÃ±aron el retratamiento, asÃ­ que conocÃ­an a los soldados nunca para retirarse de batalla.
TEXT.Russian: [TAB]The Karolins were soldiers of the Swedish kings Charles XI and Charles XII. They were part of the yearly Swedish allotment system. The Karolins' tactics were to attack fiercely and remain unafraid. The soldiers also sustained stern discipline, which over the extensive course of a twenty-year-long war would prove vital. The Swedish army tactics of the time did not teach retreat, so the soldiers were known to never withdraw from battle.

TEXT.English: This powerful gundpowder unit (the Swedish replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Musketman[COLOR_REVERT]) is immune to first strikes.
